examples: But the herd was immune.
And the manufacturing industry is not immune.
So, naturally, DNA damage triggers an immune response: inflammation.
Your body enlists several types of antibodies in its immune army.
This immune cell, a macrophage, attacks it.
words.defineEn: (usually followed by `to') not affected by a given influence
words.defineVi: (thường được theo sau bởi `to') không bị ảnh hưởng bởi một ảnh hưởng nhất định

examples: The doctor recommended using citrange as a natural remedy for boosting immunity.
Humans develop immunity.
This is immunity.
We have no immunity to new pathogens.
Babies, for example, naturally obtain passive humoral immunity while still in the womb.
words.defineEn: the quality of being unaffected by something
words.defineVi: chất lượng không bị ảnh hưởng bởi một cái gì đó

examples: But he wasn't the only man in history with tons of progeny.
So, good news, Genghis Khan: Your empire might be gone, but your progeny lives on.
words.defineEn: the immediate descendants of a person
words.defineVi: hậu duệ trực tiếp của một người

examples: So they are what we call progenitor cells.
The tendrils form as the material expands into the gas and dust that surrounded the progenitor star.
Melanocytes are pigment-producing cells, and in these fish, they form an opaque layer over the kidneys, the home of their hematopoietic stem and progenitor cells.

Of special concern are the hematopoietic stem cells, which produce every type of blood cell, as well as hematopoietic progenitor cells, which are similar but can’t renew themselves quite like stem cells can.
Marcel Duchamp was the famed progenitor of the readymade, credited as the first to put a non-art object into a gallery and call it art, and Cattelan’s banana is certainly part of that tradition.
words.defineEn: an ancestor in the direct line
words.defineVi: một tổ tiên trong dòng trực tiếp

examples: A sinfully attractive man who knows what he wants, Rafael seduces Cherri before she knows what hits her.
I was seduced by it.
You're seducing me in another man's lingerie?
In many ways, the novel follows a common narrative thread where a promising youth is seduced and corrupted by the dangers of urban life.
You were probably trying to seduce Sarah, that's my guess.
words.defineEn: induce to have sex
words.defineVi: xúi giục quan hệ tình dục

words.defineEn: putting continuous effort, care, and attention in doing something
words.defineVi: nỗ lực, quan tâm và chú ý liên tục khi làm điều gì đó

words.defineEn: a full supply
words.defineVi: cung cấp đầy đủ

words.defineEn: affording an abundant supply
words.defineVi: mang lại nguồn cung dồi dào

examples: From their leaves, flowers, and buds, to fruit, seeds, and nuts, trees have a plethora of energy sources.
Me, Chrissy, Jules, Martha, there's a whole plethora of people, alright?
No longer just a chip dip for special occasions, this superfood can be found in a plethora of recipes in cafés and restaurants everywhere around the world.
With the right mix of incentives and ingenuity, we're hopefully headed towards a future with a plethora of storage technologies.

Cash rich tech companies have thrown their weight behind a plethora of new transportation concepts, including ride hailing and apps that allow customers to quickly rent electric scooters and bicycles.
words.defineEn: extreme excess
words.defineVi: cực kỳ dư thừa

examples: It's a super easy thing to slip into because we're using a human brain ensconced in human culture to observe and interpret a non-human's actions So it takes practice and a clear understanding of why it's important not to anthropomorphize.
words.defineEn: fix firmly
words.defineVi: sửa chữa chắc chắn

examples: During his tenure from 1877 to 1911, the High Court enshrined racial segregation in American life.
Their work is now enshrined in a permanent exhibit at the International Spy Museum in Washington.
It is enshrined in the Constitution.
Although it did enshrine certain ideas about human rights Thanks for watching.
That said, these inequalities are no longer explicitly enshrined in the law, which is an example of the greater openness of class systems.
words.defineEn: enclose in a shrine
words.defineVi: bao vây trong một ngôi đền

words.defineEn: cover as if with a shroud
words.defineVi: che như thể với một tấm vải liệm

examples: There the company was ensnared in a government corruption scandal.
That's a net about the size of a large dining room tablecloth, ensnaring a small spacecraft that the mission team planted for the experiment.
But they are also fierce and expansionist warriors, and their kingdoms are ensnared in a never-ending war for survival.
And as you continue to breathe, air hardens the mucus into a solid booger, a gooey prison cell for all your ensnared enemies.
Then, when it spots a potential meal, it releases the tension line for a split second, and the spider and web shoot towards their target together and ensnare their prey.
words.defineEn: catch in or as if in a trap
words.defineVi: bắt vào hoặc như thể trong một cái bẫy

examples: And perhaps most importantly, health evangelists are praising the benefits of adding sourdough bread into your diet.
For years on the Discovery Channel, Rowe was America's hands-on evangelist for dirty jobs.
Ronald Kaltenbaugh is something of an E.V. evangelist.
Keto evangelists claim that the diet helps otherwise healthy people lose weight, boost athletic performance, and sharpen their minds.
They can reach their friends, their peer networks and be your own evangelist.
words.defineEn: a preacher of the Christian gospel
words.defineVi: một nhà truyền giáo của phúc âm Kitô giáo

examples: According to Pew, about 17 percent of adult Americans identify as white evangelicals.
But among white evangelical Americans, interest in the vaccine isn't as widespread.
As a staunch evangelical Christian, he had questioned scientific advice.
Many evangelical leaders work to overcome reluctance to receive inoculations among their followers.
We reached out to some evangelicals in our viewership to ask them about their attitudes towards the vaccines.
words.defineEn: in agreement with or relating to a Christian group that insists on the importance of the Bible and salvation through faith
words.defineVi: đồng ý với hoặc liên quan đến một nhóm Cơ đốc giáo nhấn mạnh vào tầm quan trọng của Kinh thánh và sự cứu rỗi nhờ đức tin

examples: "I was an arrogant, undisciplined, insolent midshipman who felt it necessary to prove my mettle by challenging authority."
words.defineEn: marked by casual disrespect
words.defineVi: đánh dấu bằng sự thiếu tôn trọng thông thường

words.defineEn: the trait of being rude and impertinent; inclined to take liberties
words.defineVi: đặc điểm là thô lỗ và xấc xược; có khuynh hướng tự do

words.defineEn: a strong verbal or written statement of opinion, especially one that refutes or attacks a specific opinion
words.defineVi: một tuyên bố mạnh mẽ bằng lời nói hoặc bằng văn bản của quan điểm, đặc biệt là một trong đó bác bỏ hoặc tấn công một ý kiến cụ thể

words.defineEn: of or relating to strong arguments meant to criticize or defend a particular opinion, person, idea, etc.
words.defineVi: thuộc hoặc liên quan đến những lập luận mạnh mẽ nhằm chỉ trích hoặc bảo vệ một ý kiến, con người, ý tưởng cụ thể, v.v.

words.defineEn: engage in a controversy
words.defineVi: tham gia vào một cuộc tranh cãi
